vikings,"2020-05-19T02:04:54.263Z","Great X-Wing","

I really like this X-Wing Fighter. I also own the set 30278 Poe'
column2: s X-Wing Fighter and this one is better than that (And I really liked that one as well). I would have preferred similar colors to 30278 but I do like how the blue and orange work nicely together with this X-Wing.&nbsp

column1: Comes in a polybag with normal polybag sized instructions.
You get some really good parts in this set, especially for a polybag. You get 4 dark grey ski poles and 4 carrots. You also get some orange and a few light blue parts as well.

The build was quick and easy it took a few minutes to build. The technique for the engines was really cool. The way the front of the ship connects to the back of the ship was another good technique as well.

Overall this is a great X-Wing fighter. The use of the ski poles as cannons was a great use of the piece. The technique for the engines was also really good (especially for a polybag). This is another great polybag done by Star Wars. Overall I'

,TRUE,5,5,3,4,5 BrickbyBrickDFM","2020-10-22T03:17:25.543Z","Affordable, Awesome, and Amusing - Star Wars X-Wing Polybag ","

The 2020-Star Wars microscale Poe Dameron'
column2: s X-wing Fighter LEGO set 30386 is an affordable and amusing build&nbsp
column5: including ski poles and orange carrots that serve as laser cannons (ski poles) and four thrust engines (carrots). Along with these&nbsp
column8: 72 pieces. The white, blue, and orange&nbsp
column9: color scheme only makes the x-wing look more awesome.&nbsp

column1: The usually price is $4.99, but I was able to get a number of these polybags at Walmart for $3. We used them in a timed building contest, and the family had a great time. You could either buy one or a few, use for a showpiece or have a build off. Either way, you will be glad that you owe this set.
column2: This microscale build is a must-buy. &nbsp
